result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle T. Iverson

defendant.name: Iverson, Kyle T.
defendant.address: N7925 Cty Rd K, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.

8:45 AM Defendant Kyle T. Iverson appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Kyle T. Iverson.  Attorney Emily Hynek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Swank filed bond motion. State makes argument, objects to motion, $500.00 cash bond appropriate. Court denies motion. Set for STC. JA will reach out to schedule.
Bail/bond hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Defendant requests substitution. PTC date set 10/26.

8:57 AM Defendant Kyle T. Iverson in court.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Kyle T. Iverson.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls witness Officer E.M.; sworn, states employment, identifies defendant. Record reflects identification. Officer E.M. testifies to being on duty on 9/14/22, arrested defendant. Confirmed warrants, transported to JC jail. Searched area for contraband, found methamphetamine and hypodermic needle. Contacted home owner to confirm those items found were not his. Searched squad after transport, found gem bag, tested positive for methamphetamine. Court takes judicial notice of Eau Claire Co case 21CF1164. Atty Swank cross examines Officer E.M. No other witnesses. State makes argument asks for bind over. Atty Swank makes argument objecting. Probable cause found.

Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

8:59 AM Defendant Kyle T. Iverson appeared by video, in custody JCJ.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Kyle T. Iverson. Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Waive reading of the complaint.  Set prelim within time limits.

8:59 AM Defendant Kyle T. Iverson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Kyle T. Iverson. Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting lower bond. State objects. Court denies. Current bond remains.

Bond modification hearing added per request of SPD Lucas Swank 10/10/2022 at 9 a.m.  CLO

Court not amending bond, request denied. RTD already set 10/10 @ 9 am.
